DOC.brief_title: Effect Intracervical Pain Associated With Insertion LNG-IUS
DOC.detailed_description: Objective : To evaluate effect Injectable intracervical anesthesia comparison non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug ( NSAID ) pain score immediately insertion levonorgestrel-releasing intrauterine system ( LNG-IUS ) woman without previous vaginal delivery . As secondary objective , effect intervention pain score assess 2 6 hour LNG-IUS insertion , level discomfort associate insertion procedure ease insertion LNG-IUS evaluate . Design : open randomize controlled trial Setting : Outpatient contraceptive service Patients : 100 woman want use LNG-IUS Interventions : 100 woman randomize two group : ) use NSAID ( ibuprofen , 400 mg ) 1 hour LNG-IUS insertion ; b ) 2 % lidocaine intracervical injection . These woman evaluate immediately LNG-IUS insertion , 2 hour 6 hour . Main outcome measure : Two pain scale use ( visual analogue scale facial pain scale ) addition assess ease insertion ( rat provider ) level discomfort procedure ( rat patient ) . Multivariate logistic regression perform analyze predictor associate moderate/severe pain .
DOC.criteria: patient want use LNGIUS contraceptive age 18 45 year nulliparity absence previous vaginal delivery woman categories 3 and/or 4 LNGIUS use accord medical eligibility criterion World Health Organization illicit drug and/or alcohol user woman allergy contraindication NSAIDs lidocaine chronic pelvic pain etiology abnormality cervix ( fibrosis isthmuscervical incompetence ) previous abortion without uterine curettage psychiatric disorder continue use medication could interfere pain threshold
